name: Chakalaka Chicken Skillet with Basmati Rice
description: Tender chicken thigh pieces simmered in a mild chakalaka sauce with peppers and onions, served over fluffy basmati rice. Weeknight-friendly and family-pleasing.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups basmati rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Cut 700 g chicken thigh fillets into bite-size pieces; pat dry.
Roughly chop a small handful of parsley.
cook_steps: Add 3 cups chicken stock to a pot; bring to a boil. Stir in rinsed basmati rice, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest off heat, covered, 5 minutes; fluff.
While rice cooks, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Sear in two batches 3–4 minutes per side until browned; transfer to a plate.
Return skillet to medium heat with 1 tbsp olive oil. Add onion and bell peppers; cook 4–5 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in 1 can chakalaka and bring to a simmer. Return chicken and any juices to the pan; simmer 4–6 minutes until chicken is cooked through and sauce slightly thickens. Adjust salt and pepper.
Squeeze half the lemon over the skillet (to taste).
Fluff rice and serve bowls of rice topped with chakalaka chicken. Garnish with parsley and extra lemon wedges if desired.
